Классная игра с батей под пиво смотрим и болеем за NAVI

This is the game that got me into video games. Each match you play, you meet new and fun people. You can make somebody's day, you hear their relationship problems, share advice, and laugh so much anyone who lives with you will threaten to tie your monitor to the back of a school bus and let it drive away. This game teaches life lessons of teamwork, communication, and focus. It makes you think, and the community outside of gameplay is life changing. I remember getting scammed out of expensive items once, it was my own fault. So I gave away a few hundred dollars worth of items to people who also got scammed, and then some to some randoms. My point is, you will meet very unique people that will have an impact on you in one way or another. Oh, and I also was able to buy a beautiful mustang for my first car using the profits I made from this game.

Now the actual gameplay, CSGO is a 5v5 fps that feels so natural to play. The movement is overlooked, but it makes you feel immersed within the game because it's made so well. It's incredibly easy to shut the lights off and feel like you're really in the game. I've played thousands of competitive matches, each being about 45 minutes long; that's a lot of minutes. Not one of those minutes was familiar, not one second of that game was repeated. There is infinite replay factor in this game and every moment of it is truly unique and that's the most amazing thing about it for me. The weapons are easy to learn; no complicated attachments. Kills are extremely satisfying. The teamwork is addicting, and dying in this game can be great motivation to get ripped. Take my advice, start with a couple push-ups each time you die. When it gets too easy, bump it up. Soon enough people will be asking how you got so beautifully strong and muscular, and you can reply by telling them you sit on your ass and play CSGO all night. I love this game and it's the only one I know I can never get bored of and will play forever
